intro: Oxydectes argentina, commonly known as the Argentine oxydectes, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Oxydectes argentina is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
